title: Uncaught TypeError on Main App Load (Fixed: Aug 15, 2025) - v2.7.9
resolution: A recurring TypeError on page load was caused by multiple event listeners in `admin.js` being attached before their corresponding elements in the Developer Mode panel were rendered. The fix was to refactor the `initAdmin` function to use a single event listener on the parent `developerView` container. This 'Event Delegation' approach ensures that all clicks within the developer panel are handled correctly, regardless of when the script runs, resolving the timing issue.

title: Uncaught TypeError on Garage Management Load (Fixed: Aug 15, 2025) - v2.7.5
resolution: A TypeError occurred because `garage.js` was trying to access `App.unlockedGarages` before it was initialized, and the 'unlock-garage-modal' was missing from `index.html`. The fix involved initializing `unlockedGarages` as an empty array in `main.js` and adding the required modal HTML to `index.html`.

title: Clear All Data Function Deletes Feature Requests (Fixed: Aug 15, 2025) - v2.7.3
resolution: The `clear_all_data` function in `app.py` was updated to remove the 'feature_requests' collection from its list of targets for deletion. This preserves valuable user feedback while still allowing developers to clear user-generated content like profiles, vehicles, and events for testing purposes.

title: Data Management UI Not Appearing in Developer Mode (Fixed: Aug 15, 2025) - v2.6.6
resolution: The `index.html` file was missing the necessary HTML for the 'Data Management & Seeding' section. The file has been updated to include the correct div and buttons, which now correctly connect to the event listeners in `admin.js`.

title: Uncaught TypeError on Main App Load (Fixed: Aug 15, 2025) - v2.6.5
resolution: The event listeners for the 'Seed Database' and 'Clear All Data' buttons were being attached in `initAdmin` on initial page load, before the Developer Mode view (and its buttons) were rendered. This caused a 'Cannot read properties of null' error. The fix was to move these two event listener attachments into the `loadAdminSettings` function, which is only called after the Developer Mode view is visible, ensuring the elements exist before listeners are attached.
